summary: The Arctic Watchers Act aims to establish a program within the Department of State to monitor the Arctic region, combat foreign malign influence (particularly from Russia and China), and promote U.S. interests in the area. The Secretary of State, in coordination with the Secretary of Defense, will assign 'Arctic Watchers' to posts in countries with Arctic interests.  The bill mandates reports to Congress on the program's activities and authorizes $10 million in annual appropriations. The bill defines the Arctic region based on the Arctic Research and Policy Act.
